title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 296-1.13 - Parking permits for the disabled
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 296-1.13 - Parking permits for the disabled

State Regulations
(a) Employees who are disabled and require
special parking considerations due to their condition must take the following
steps in order to obtain a special permit: (1)

The employee must complete the
"Application for Medical Parking Permit" and the "Employee Health Service

Release of Medical Information for Parking Eligibility."
(2)

The employee must obtain a physician's
statement outlining the disability. (3)

The employee must request his/her agency
parking coordinator to arrange for an examination with the Employee Health

Service. (4)

The employee must
submit the physician's statement to the Employee Health Service at the
examination. (b) The

Employee Health Service will then supply copies of their recommendation to the
applicant's personnel office and the Bureau of Parking Services. If the

Employee Health Service recommends special parking arrangements and the
employer agency approves the application, the agency parking coordinator will
contact the employee to coordinate the appropriate arrangements. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
§§
296-1.13

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
